title: Single sort ID - fat Didone 'r'
content:
Hello All,

I have bought this nice single sort you can see in the attached picture and now I am trying to identify to what typeface/fount it belongs to. It was sold as a capital J but I reckon it may be a lowercase r instead, but so far I have not found it on MyFonts.

Thank you in advance,

Tamas

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [singler.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820152647/http:/typophile.com/files/singler.jpg) | 10.42 KB |
author: Atwe

comments.content:
It's oddly shaped to be either letter, but to me it seems more plausible as a J. I was not able to find anything resembling it, but it might help if you reversed the image or actually printed the thing so we could see it as both potential letters.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you, Mike - I will do that when I get the opportunity. The reason I thought it was an 'r' was that the sort has a groove on the serif side of the body.
